discussion.content:
Module 09 Page 928
https://bookshelf.vitalsource.com/reader/books/9781635676969/pageid/942
IIS creates a new log file for the next day at midnight in GMT.

--> new log file is created everyday.

Selected Answer: B
Page 928 "When IIS records the logs in the W3C Extended Log Format, the IIS stores all the logged events in the GMT format, instead of the format of the local time zone for the system. This point must be considered during the examination of the logs because IIS creates a new log file for the next day at midnight in GMT. "

In a Windows IIS web server, a new log file is created on a daily basis. Therefore, the correct answer is B.

Explanation:
When IIS logging is enabled, the web server writes log files that contain information about the requests processed by the server. These log files are typically used for troubleshooting, performance monitoring, and security auditing.

In a default IIS installation, the web server generates a new log file each day, with the file name format of "u_exYYMMDD.log", where YYMMDD represents the year, month, and day of the log file. For example, the log file for March 25, 2023, would be named "u_ex230325.log".

The log files are stored in the W3SVC folder under the Windows system root directory (e.g., C:\Windows\System32\LogFiles\W3SVC).

Therefore, the correct answer is B, a new log file is created every day.
C - By default, each IIS Site hosted will begin recording web logs into %SystemDrive%\inetpub\logs\LogFiles and it will create a new file every day
B. a new log file is created everyday

choices.D: a new log is created each time the Web Server is started
choices.C: a new log file is created each week
choices.B: a new log file is created everyday
choices.A: the same log is used at all times

questions.question_text: When examining the log files from a Windows IIS Web Server, how often is a new log file created?

discussion.content:
https://bookshelf.vitalsource.com/reader/books/9781635676969/pageid/1468
Module 15 / Mobile Forensics Process / Preserve the Evidence
Page 1469:
Signal Disruption Bag/ Wireless StrongHold Bag
It prevents any type of signal from reaching a mobile device. It also prevents changes that may occur in a phone due to receiving a signal

--> Wireless cards

This is a very stupid question and the usage is pathetically opaque.

Selected Answer: A
A: any device that uses electromagnetic waves for telecommunication.
A stronghold bag should store any MOBILE DEVICE.

Selected Answer: C
A forensics investigator would store hard drives in a StrongHold bag. The bag is designed to shield electronic devices from electromagnetic interference, which can potentially damage or alter the data on the device. This is especially important for hard drives, which can be easily damaged by electromagnetic fields.

questions.question_text: What type of equipment would a forensics investigator store in a StrongHold bag?

discussion.content: B < The amount of data reduction possible using lossy compression is much higher than using lossless techniques.

questions.question_text: If you are concerned about a high level of compression but not concerned about any possible data loss, what type of compression would you use?
Which of the following does Microsoft Exchange E-mail Server use for collaboration of various e-mail applications?

discussion.content: Primarily uses MAPI to talk to email clients, but subsequently added support for POP3, IMAP, and EAS. The standard SMTP protocol is used to communicate to other Internet mail servers.

he correct answer is B. Ping of death.
ICMP (Internet Control Message Protocol) packets larger than 65,536 bytes are indicative of a "Ping of Death" attack. This type of attack involves sending malformed or malicious ICMP packets, specifically echo request (ping) packets, that exceed the maximum allowed size (65,536 bytes). This can cause the target system to crash, freeze, or become unstable.
Here's a brief overview of the other options:
A. Smurf attack: a type of DDoS attack that uses ICMP echo requests (pings) to flood a network, but the packets are typically not larger than 65,536 bytes.
C. Fraggle attack: a type of DDoS attack that uses UDP packets, not ICMP packets, to flood a network.
D. Nmap scan: a network scanning tool used for discovery and exploration, which typically doesn't involve sending large ICMP packets

Selected Answer: B
The ping of death (PoD) attack is a DDoS attack that sends out abnormally large packets in order to disrupt a web server.

questions.question_text: An investigator is searching through the firewall logs of a company and notices ICMP packets that are larger than 65,536 bytes. What type of activity is the investigator seeing?
